question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Compute
\[\begin{vmatrix} 7 & 3 \\ -1 & 2 \end{vmatrix}.\]
inference:
The determinant of a $2 \times 2$ matrix $\begin{pmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{pmatrix}$ is given by $ad - bc$.
In this case, we have
\[\begin{vmatrix} 7 & 3 \\ -1 & 2 \end{vmatrix} = (7)(2) - (3)(-1) = 14 - (-3) = 14 + 3 = 17.\]
Final Answer: $\boxed{17}$ I hope it is correct.

question:
The determinant of a $2 \times 2$ matrix $\begin{pmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{pmatrix}$ is given by $ad - bc$.
In this case, we have
\[\begin{vmatrix} 7 & 3 \\ -1 & 2 \end{vmatrix} = (7)(2) - (3)(-1) = 14 - (-3) = 14 + 3 = 17.\]
Final Answer: $\boxed{17}$ I hope it is correct.

inference:
The determinant of the given $2 \times 2$ matrix $\begin{pmatrix} 7 & 3 \\ -1 & 2 \end{pmatrix}$ is
\[ (7)(2) - (3)(-1) = 14 - (-3) = 14 + 3 = 17.\]
Thus, the determinant is 17.

Final Answer: $\boxed{17}$
